means: lend ： 指将自己的东西借出给别人，也可用于借喻意义。
borrow ： 指从某人或某处借来某物，也可用作比喻。
loan ： 指通过正式的手续，借数目较大的贷款。在美国也可指借出东西。

sentence.Network_en: Will you lend me your jacket for a little while?
sentence.Network_cn: 你能把上衣借给我穿一会儿吗？

sentence.Network_en: Stipe attended yesterday's news conference to lend his support.
sentence.Network_cn: 斯蒂普出席了昨天的新闻发布会以示支持。

sentence.Network_en: However you dress it up, a bank only exists to lend money.
sentence.Network_cn: 无论你如何粉饰，银行就是为了放贷而生的。

phrase.cizu_name: lend a hand (或 a helping hand)

lj.lj_ly: the Samaritans lend their ears to those in crisis.

jx.jx_en_mean: allow oneself to be publicly associated with

lj.lj_ly: he lent his name and prestige to the organizers of the project.
lj.lj_ls: 他以自己的名义和声望支持这项计划的组 织者。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English lǣnan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch lenen, also to loan. The addition of the final -d in late Middle English was due to association with verbs such as bend and send

entry.def: When people or organizations such as banks lend you money, they give it to you and you agree to pay it back at a future date, often with an extra amount as interest.

example.ex: The bank is reassessing its criteria for lending money...
example.tran: 银行正重新评估其贷款标准。

example.ex: I had to lend him ten pounds to take his children to the pictures.
example.tran: 我只好借给他10英镑，让他带孩子们去看电影。

entry.def: If you lend something that you own, you allow someone to have it or use it for a period of time.

example.ex: Will you lend me your jacket for a little while?...
example.tran: 你能把上衣借给我穿一会儿吗？

example.ex: He had lent the bungalow to the Conrads for a couple of weeks.
example.tran: 他把那间平房借给康拉德一家住了两三个星期。

entry.def: If you lend your support to someone or something, you help them with what they are doing or with a problem that they have.

example.ex: He was approached by the organisers to lend support to a benefit concert...
example.tran: 主办方找过他，希望他能对慈善音乐会给予支持。

example.ex: Stipe attended yesterday's news conference to lend his support.
example.tran: 斯蒂普出席了昨天的新闻发布会以示支持。

entry.tran: 使适合；使有帮助；使易遭受
entry.def: If something lends itself to a particular activity or result, it is easy for it to be used for that activity or to achieve that result.

example.ex: The room lends itself well to summer eating with its light, airy atmosphere.
example.tran: 这个房间又亮堂又通风，夏天在此用餐最合适不过。

entry.def: If something lends a particular quality to something else, it adds that quality to it.

example.ex: Enthusiastic applause lent a sense of occasion to the proceedings...
example.tran: 热烈的掌声给活动平添了几分隆重的色彩。

example.ex: A more relaxed regime and regular work lends the inmates a dignity not seen in other prisons.
example.tran: 由于管理较为宽松而且经常从事劳动，这里的囚犯因此多了一份其他监狱的囚犯所没有的尊严感。

sentences.sentence: "Her presence lends a certain cachet to the company"
"The music added a lot to the play"
"She brings a special atmosphere to our meetings"
"This adds a light note to the program"

means.word_mean: 2. give temporarily; let have for a limited time;
3. have certain characteristics of qualities for something; be open or vulnerable to;

sentences.sentence: "This story would lend itself well to serialization on television"
"The current system lends itself to great abuse"

Sentence.sentence: The government now backs up the domestic car industry, lending it money and overseeing its turnaround plans.

They are owned by individuals and by private businesses and corporations, lending institutions, direct mailing and telemarketing firms, credit bureaus, credit card companies, and government agencies at the local, state, and federal level.

Most of the books she lent out came back without jackets.
She can lend the man a sleeping bag.

sentences.cn: 他既不借给人也不向人借。

sentences.en: Don't lend yourself to such dishonest schemes.
sentences.cn: 别参与这种欺诈的勾当。

sentences.en: This poem lends itself to our program very well.
sentences.cn: 这首诗非常适合我们的节目。

jushi.english: The bank currently lent at 10 per cent interest.
jushi.chinese: 目前银行以10%的利息向外贷款。
他既不借给人也不向人借。

jushi.english: They are quick to lend aid in time of disaster.
jushi.chinese: 在人们遭受灾害时,他们会迅速给予援助。
